meanings.definition: A large and luxurious country residence
meanings.sent1: The wealthy family owned a grand villa in the countryside.
meanings.sent2: The villa had a beautiful garden and a swimming pool.
meanings.sent3: The villa was so fancy, even the birds seemed to wear tiny top hats around it.
meanings.sent4: The villa stood like a regal queen amidst the rolling hills.
meanings.sent5: The villa's opulence was unmatched, with chandeliers in every room.

meanings.definition: A detached or semi-detached house in a residential area
meanings.sent1: Their cozy villa had a small garden in the front.
meanings.sent2: The villas in the neighborhood all had unique architectural styles.
meanings.sent3: The villa looked like a friendly giant waving at passersby.
meanings.sent4: The row of villas stood like soldiers guarding the street.
meanings.sent5: The villa's white picket fence added charm to the suburban street.

meanings.definition: A style of house or building typically found in Mediterranean countries
meanings.sent1: The villa's terracotta roof gleamed under the Mediterranean sun.
meanings.sent2: In Greece, you can see many villas overlooking the sea.
meanings.sent3: The villa seemed to hum a Mediterranean tune as the breeze passed through.
meanings.sent4: The villa's white walls shone like pearls against the blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The villa's architecture transported you to a Mediterranean dream.
